title: Novel electronics for MCP imaging detectors
abstract:
We describe novel electronics for processing signals from a microchannel plate detector using a resistive anode\ud
readout. High sampling-rate (MHz) Analogue-to-Digital Converters (ADCs) coupled to a Digital Signal Processor\ud
(DSP) combine to offer high spatial resolution 70 micrometre low noise <0.1 count cm^-1 s^-1 imaging over a large 93 mm  x\ud
93 mm imaging area.\ud
These new low-cost electronics form an integral part of a MCP-based system for digital autoradiography designed to\ud
image radiolabelled thin tissue slices and 1- and 2-D electrophoresis gels

These new low-cost electronics form an integral part of a MCP-based system for digital autoradiography designed to\ud
